result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance Eugene Talbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 3-11-2016. Any remaining balance due will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence; no release privileges; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance Eugene Talbert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrance Eugene Talbert in court with attorney David C. Bangert.  Defendant Terrance Eugene Talbert in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to the Oral Amended Charge COUNT 1:
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court ordered defendant to serve 20 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; no release privileges; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, by 3-11-2016. Any remaining balance due will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
On the oral motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41 (3g)(e), a Misdemeanor.

Attorney David C. Bangert in court, defendant Terrance Eugene Talbert not in court, in custody. Paul Hauer for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record. Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Defendant is in custody not produced.  Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 3-11-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defnese Attorney David C. Bangert in court, defendant Terrance Eugene Talbert not in court, in custody. Paul Hauer for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record. Case scheduled for Indigency Hearing. Defense counsel previously presented the Court with a letter dated January 19, 2015 stating that the Defendant has retained him as counsel and due to schedule conflicts requests an adjournment. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 2-24-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance Eugene Talbert in court.  Paul Hauer for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant informs the court that he wishes to proceed with any court proceedings pro se. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing on.  Same Bail.   Indigency Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Terrance Eugene Talbert in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Terrance Eugene Talbert in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.    
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
